channel.title: Timers?
channel.description:
Well, I have NEVER posted a thread here needing help because I try to learn on my own, BUT... I just can't figure out how to get this done.
Currently I am working on my own little minigame, and it is gong along AWESOME. I am trying to add a timer(somewhat like cw in real runescape) that will tele you to the game once the time is up. Currently I am using process() and an int that goes down every minute, then says how many minutes are left. There's one problem with that. The timer is different for all people, because they log in at different times. =\
How do I get an int to be the same for all, and subtract at the same time as everyone else? If somebody could help me I would greatly appreciate it, because this is about all that's keeping me from releasing/putting up my server. ^_^ [br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2007, 06:50:32 PM[/size][hr]I am looking for something like a playercount if that helps, but not to count players, just be able to be the same for everyone no matter what time they come to the game or login =S. [br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2007, 06:59:06 PM[/size][hr]Ok, I am trying now with a public static int, and using playerhandler... Hope this works :s[br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2007, 07:12:36 PM[/size][hr]Nobody knows? :X
